article.headline: Texas-Pan American 69, Texas-San Antonio 64
article.story: EDINBURG, Texas (AP) -- Colin Lien scored 17 points, including five in the final two minutes, to help lead Texas-Pan American to a 69-64 victory over Texas-San Antonio on Wednesday night. Texas-Pan American's Kano Edwards tied the game at 58-58 with a pair of free throws with 3:15 left and Dexter Shankle hit a 3-pointer to give the Broncs the lead for good with 2:48 left. Paul Stoll scored 12 points and Johnathan Chatman and Brian Burrell each scored 11 for Texas-Pan American (7-5). Keith Spencer led Texas-San Antonio (4-7) with 17 points and Melvin Smith added 16. Kurt Attaway had 11. Texas-San Antonio used a 20-3 run to start the second half and take a 44-35 lead with 14:04 left. Texas-Pan American shot 55 percent from the field while the Roadrunners shot 43 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
